tool_description: Robust API to access every kind of data Instagram has to offer. Only pay for successful responses. Automatic re-try.
name: Instagram Data
title: Instagram Data

api_list.name: WEB Location info
api_list.description:
Get information about a location.
You can find a list of locations here [here](https://www.instagram.com/explore/locations/)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-data14.p.rapidapi.com/web/locations/212918601/info"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-data14.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-data14.p.rapidapi.com/web/locations/{id}/info"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-data14.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Convert media id <-> shortcode
api_list.description:
Convert media id (2917172418798642453) to shortcode (Ch74NvrD2UV).
Only specify either id or shortcode to get the other equivalent.

api_list.name: WEB User feed
api_list.description: Get the user feed by user id.

optional_parameters.name: after
optional_parameters.description: Fetch more media from the same user, can be obtained by `end_cursor`

optional_parameters.name: first
optional_parameters.description: How many posts to retrieve in one request.

api_list.name: WEB Media info
api_list.description:
Get information about a specific media.
Id can be either shortcode (Ch74NvrD2UV) or media id (2917172418798642453)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://instagram-data14.p.rapidapi.com/web/media/Ch74NvrD2UV/info"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "instagram-data14.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: WEB Proxy JSON
api_list.description:
An endpoint to fetch JSON data from the Instagram website.
You can add `?__a=1&__d=dis` to any url to retrieve JSON.

For example. `https://www.instagram.com/instagram/` becomes `https://www.instagram.com/instagram/?__a=1&__d=dis`

There are other endpoints we support such as getting a user feed:
`https://www.instagram.com/graphql/query/?query_hash=69cba40317214236af40e7efa697781d&variables=' + encodeURIComponent('{"id":"<ID>","first":12})`

If there is interest, we can add documentation for this.
Let us know any problems or questions.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The url you want to call.
